Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2022038993.CaseDesc: Phuong Nam Vu is a Vietnamese national who came to Canada on a student visa for a two-week summer program in July and August 2022 to improve his English speaking skills. He participated in the first week of the summer program but did not attend the second week. On August 12, 2022, school employees reported Phuong Nam missing, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000125.CaseDesc: Bonnie Joan Thomas (née Cooper) of Rollingdam, just outside of St. Stephen, NB, met with some friends and went across the U.S. border to the Legion in Calais, Maine.  They went to a St. Patrick's Day dance. After the evening's celebrations, Bonnie left the Legion alone in her red 1973 Volvo station wagon. She drove back through the Calais/St. Stephen border crossing into Canada. At the Canadian entry point Bonnie hit the customs booth causing minor damage to her car. She was last seen talking to the Customs Officer. The next morning her husband realized she was missing, and called the police. Bonnie's car was found abandoned on March 18, 1978, near St. Stephen on a logging road near the St Croix River.

Case reference: 2019075256.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020 between 4:00 and 5:00 am, Joel Judd was last seen leaving a party at a residence in Slave Lake, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was last seen between late June and August 1990 in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, and was reported missing in September 1990. At the time of her disappearance, Mary Rose was residing at the Gold Range Hotel. In 2003, partial human remains were discovered in Yellowknife, and forensic DNA analysis determined that the remains were those of Mary Rose Keadjuk in 2018. The investigation into her disappearance  is still active and ongoing.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2013000006.CaseDesc: Joseph Taylor was last seen leaving his residence around midnight on July 30, 2001. He left his residence in a despondent state. It is believed he has started a new life and possibly a new identity for himself in the area around Kelowna in British Columbia. He may be working as a general labourer.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Sword with snake around (5cm)

Case reference: 2021057203.CaseDesc: Liam Askin was reported missing by family on December 10, 2021. He was last seen at the east Banff Park gates on November 15, 2020. Liam has significant mental and physical illnesses. There have been no confirmed footprints of life since.

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2014005431.CaseDesc: Mahendiran Ratnasingam last spoke with his ex-wife on June 8th, 2006, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000071.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1993, Jean-Jacques Cantin was seen for the last time in the Ahuntsic district of Montreal, Quebec. His mother went to his apartment where she found packages that were prepared for different people. His personal belongings and clothes had disappeared.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Betty Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, SK. Mrs. Primeau was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate Mrs. Primeau.

Case reference: 2012020651.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1984, Patricia Favel was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario, after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  At the time of his disappearance, Ben suffered from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, Often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, Winter coat with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2007002299.CaseDesc: Michelle Bigras last spoke to her mother on October 11, 1985. At the time she was planning to hitchhike to Warkworth Institution, located near Warkworth, Ontario, to visit her boyfriend. She never arrived.

Scar: Eyes, 2 small scars on left eyebrow

Case reference: 2022040012.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2022, Joseph Aldonia Chiasson was seen for the last time by his loved ones in the Shippagan region in New Brunswick. There have been unconfirmed reports he was seen in the Lamèque, NB area on August 12, 2022.

Deformity: Right Leg, Limps on Right leg

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2014002878.CaseDesc: On February 26, 2001, Albert Fare was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Albert was despondent.

Scar: Neck, Surgical; back of the neck

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2006024099.CaseDesc: David Jennings was last seen on June 13, 1991. He is presumed to have drowned on Blackstone Lake in Archipelago Township.

Jacket: Silk, Blue, across shoulders "Bass Fishing"  picture bass fish

Case reference: 2020014650.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1919, at approximately 5:30pm, Ambrose Small was seen for the last time with his lawyer in his office at the Grand Opera House in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, Dark colour with velvet collar

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2021014455.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2018, Sonya Manning was seen for the last time in Buffalo, New York State. Sonya’s vehicle was located in close proximity to the falls in Niagara Falls. During the time of her disappearance, she was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Right Ankle, A butterfly or flower
Forehead, Turquoise jagged edges at hairline

Case reference: 2014001708.CaseDesc: Marlene Abigosis was last seen in March of 1984 in the downtown east side of Vancouver. Ms. Abigosis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. M. Abigosis was known to work near the docks, and clients that owned boats would take Marlene with them on trips to Washington State and Vancouver Island on occasion.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2017056036.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2017, Jason McGrath was last seen modifying his kayak at the family's cottage in Cape George, Nova Scotia. Jason had indicated that he intended on taking the kayak out onto the water. The kayak and Jason’s other personal belongings were recovered on a shore in Judique, Nova Scotia.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Red circle with flames

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2014004448.CaseDesc: Carmelo Tomasino was last seen on January 19, 2004 in Montreal. His absence and not calling home is out of character.

Tattoo: Chest, Hearts with the names Amanda and Brenda

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2018040315.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Joshua Hill was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006011199.CaseDesc: On May 9, 1986, Gregory Beaumont left the Silver Lake Campground by boat to fish on the lake. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2017056443.CaseDesc: Kristina Ward is a 20 years old aboriginal female who has been missing since September 27, 2017. Kristina is schizophrenic and is possibly using drugs. Kristina is developmentally delayed and is described as being vulnerable and easily trust people she does not know.  Kristina has money and a cellphone, however, neither have been used or accessed since September 27, 2017. Kristina was last seen in Surrey at the intersection of 104th Avenue and 144th St. with an unidentified male.

Mark: Upper Lip, Birthmark on upper left lip

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014005971.CaseDesc: Mrs. Guifeng Tong was last seen on video surveillance at her apartment on January 16, 2013 at 0958hrs. She was known to frequent Crystal Mall, Lougheed Mall and Metrotown Mall. She also likes to pick mushrooms at numerous parks in the lower mainland.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2006021599.CaseDesc: Zbigniew Gajda left Thunder Bay on his snowmobile to go ice fishing on Lake Superior.  He was last seen on January 4, 2001 around Caribou Island Point.  It is thought that his snowmobile may have gone through the ice.

Jacket: Black, Purple and blue on arms

Case reference: 2014004588.CaseDesc: On November 23, 1986, Pierre-Jean Durocher was last seen. He was reported missing on November 25, 1986, by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. Durocher lived in a rooming house in Longueuil. His backpack containing his identification was found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge in Montreal.

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014004021.CaseDesc: On July 10th, 1998, Ronald Oxley was last seen leaving his residence in Thompson Manitoba. He told friends he was going to the bank and then to the grocery store. Mr. Oxley has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Nose, One inch long, left side

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: On December 3rd 1996, family members of Jaime Wyatt made a report to the St-John's RCMP that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Mr. Wyatt, a resident of Newfoundland, left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime Wyatt had been staying at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. His motel room was paid in full until the 17th of November 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Mr. Wyatt informed the staff at the Twin Elms that someone was going to be picking him up to go out to a dinner party and other functions that evening. Mr. Wyatt was never heard from or seen since that day. Foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014001268.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1998, Terry Jasman wandered off from the Bow City Gravel Pit on the Bow River near Brooks, Alberta.  Terry Jasman's trailer and truck were later found abandoned.

Jeans: Denim, Light Blue, Faded blue jeans

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On October 2nd, 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. Investigators concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Ms.Klok has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Mr. Allen.

Case reference: 2014003777.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1988, François Piquet was seen for the last time when he left the family residence located in the Saint-Laurent district of Montreal, Quebec. François left his ID cards behind and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019054192.CaseDesc: Danick Bourgeois was seen for the last time during the month of July 2019. He has been known to reside in a homemade trailer in St. Bernadin, Ontario and in a tent near Hawkesbury, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004763.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2005, Leslie Thompson was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Leslie is known as a gambler and frequents bars.

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Peter Russell Yellowbird was reported missing by his family after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for so long. It is believed that Mr. Yellowbird’s last known location was in the Downtown area of Edmonton. Mr. Yellowbird’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest foul play.

Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2021032527.CaseDesc: The last time Robert Martin was heard from or seen was in the late 1960s. He was last observed working as a miner in the North West Territories. Police had unsuccessfully performed searches for birth and death data. Robert's current whereabouts are unknown.

Mark: Abdomen, Birthmark, white patch of skin around the belly button
Forehead, Birthmark, white patch of skin, white hair hairline

Case reference: 2012020012.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Surtel was last seen April 28, 2007 at his residence in Mission, BC. Jeff is believed to have left his home riding a distinctive blue CCM mountain bike with yellow forks.

Case reference: 2019073733.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, Trevor Batoche was seen for the last time in Penticton, British Columbia. Trevor was known to frequently travel to Northern British Columbia and Edmonton, Alberta, possibly driving an older black pickup truck.

Case reference: 2014001612.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1975, Renée Larose was seen for the last time when she left her home in the borough of Rosemont-La Petite-Patrie in the city of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014001394.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 2002 Jeremy Crawford was seen for the last time at his residence in Crystal Beach, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls, Ontario on the same date. At the time of his disappearance, Jeremy was despondent.

Case reference: 2021000934.CaseDesc: On January 25, 2002, Vincent Lamouris was seen for the last time near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Shoes: Black, Dress shoes; brand: Mephisto; with a buckle on the side
Sweater: Wool, Black, Long sleeves; Ralph Lauren logo on the chest
Watch: White, Wrist watch; brand: Rodania; with a black leather strap

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born and raised on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, SK and resided there up until the time he went missing. He was described by friends and family as being a loner who kept to himself. Mr. Entz left the colony on the evening of 2011-09-18 at which time he was seen driving away on a tractor which was later recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Mr. Entz has involved numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2015036270.CaseDesc: Brian Franko was last seen on July 10, 2015, walking away from the Saskatchewan Hospital.  He did not appear to be in a good frame of mind.  Brian was walking toward the South Saskatchewan River when he was last seen.  Extensive searches were conducted, with no success.

Case reference: 2018041669.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2003, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Yunerkis Cervantes-Estrada was seen for the last time at her residence in Toronto, Ontario. On the following day, Yunerkis left a note at her house which indicated that she was going to a party.

Case reference: 2014003846.CaseDesc: On March 1st, 1992, Blaine Prince and his friend were on a ski-doo on the river with two other friends. As they were driving on the river the lead ski-doo encountered ice that gave away however they accelerated to stronger ice. Mr. Prince and his friend were not as lucky and broke through the ice. Both men were observed hanging onto the edge of the ice however Mr. Prince soon let go and did not re-surface.

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2014001879.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Patrick Auger left his residence in Desmarais, Alberta, to travel to Slave Lake, Alberta. On November 1, 1983, Patrick was observed getting onto a Greyhound Bus bound for Peace River, Alberta, from Slave Lake.

Deformity: Right Fourth Toe, Deformed from previous fracture
Right Large Toe, Toe twisted from healed fracture

Case reference: 2014041193.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2014, Colten Pratt was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014002473.CaseDesc: On July 4, 1991, Gabriel Bukredji was seen for the last time in the Saint-Leonard district of Montreal, Quebec. Gabriel was despondent and had also mentioned he was interested in purchasing property in another country.

Sweater: Pink, Blue circle on the back.

Case reference: 2014002711.CaseDesc: Sharel Haresym was reported missing September 6, 1984, he was last seen was on September 4, 1984. Mr. Haresym's vehicle was located parked on the entrance road to Twin Lakes campground near Winfield, Alberta. The vehicle was out of fuel and also had a dead battery. Mr. Haresym's clothing was located approximately 100 yards east of his vehicle. His clothing was laid out in a neat and orderly fashion with his bible alongside.

Case reference: 2016058794.CaseDesc: Raymond Raine was reported missing in 2016 after family members had not heard from him in several years. Raymond has ties to Maskwacis, Alberta, but was last known to be in the Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.
